N82E16834100718.Title: MacBook Air B Grade
N82E16834100718.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834100718.Pros: -Good to excellent performance for an older device
N82E16834100718.Comments: I purchased this MacBook Air because I needed a laptop for basic school work and down time video streaming. Honestly, it’s get that job done well. In comparison to a Windows machine my parents got me for Christmas years ago from around the same time of this MacBooks release, this machine caught me by surprise. Yea, the body was a little beat up, a few dings in very few places, but nothing like what I’ve seen some of the reviews saying there were. Honestly, my machine, I was surprised to see cake in better condition than I was expecting for a $300 MacBook. That’s where I run into a problem, it’s $300. The only major issue I have is the overheating problem I’ll have while doing work. I figured that had to do with age, which is to be expected, cleared out the air filter a bit, used a can of air to take out any residual dust in the fans and it improved by quite a bit. The battery life itself I managed to actually get 3.5 hours max even though I was overheating, but that’s also because I stopped using Chrome as my main browser. I even notice on my Windows machine I personally built and on my room mates windows laptop that I used to test my theory, that chrome did run up the temps and usage. But that still didn’t clear up the problem, just stops it from happening as much. If you’re going to be video streaming, try to lower the quality settings to 480p or 720p, streaming at 1080p will cause it to overheat. Other than that, if you want a good performing machine say for your child who needs one for college without breaking an arm or leg or a sacrifice of your wallets internal organs, then this machine will be more than perfect. I may upgrade this one in a year or so, but for now, I’m very content with this device and I hope to see others make this purchase too. If it wasn’t for the overheating, I honestly rate it 5 eggs. Battery life I can’t truly complain because most laptops are only 4 hours of life and that’s even some 2018 models. So good job Apple for making a long lasting device and good job Newegg for the good refurbishing. Happy customer right here! :D

N82E16834100718.Title: Nice device for my needs
N82E16834100718.Author: John H.
N82E16834100718.Cons: Apple severely limited this device - only 2Gb of RAM, 64Gb SSD - both soldered to the board - no upgrade possible.  USB 2 ports (although there are 2 of them, at least).  I don't think most folks would like "living" in this laptop for an extended time.
N82E16834100718.Pros: Relatively small, light, fairly sturdy - easy to pack.  Compared to laptops I usually buy, nice screen, speakers and touchpad.  Relatively inexpensive.  Good second laptop.
N82E16834100718.Comments: Prefix:  I saw other comments about condition issues, and expected dents and scratches.  I was pleasantly surprised - this laptop would look completely new if it weren't for a scratch on the bottom cover about 3 mm long.  Amazing!

N82E16834261428.Title: Great Laptop, Bad Hard Drive, Invalid Windows 10 key
N82E16834261428.Author: Patrick J.
N82E16834261428.Comments: I ordered this laptop for my customer. The laptop arrived one business day late. The laptop worked like a charm until the installation of Windows 10 Creators Update which gave me a 0xc000000f bsod error. I scanned the HDD for errors, found no bad sector. Crystaldiskinfo gave it a "BAD" label. I i decided to use one of my hard drives in it because my customer could not afford to wait for a replacement laptop. The laptop now works like a charm!! Too bad the hard drive was faulty! One thing I found weird is that the laptop was advertised with 250gb HDD and it had a WD black 7200rpm 320gb broken HDD in it! EDIT: with the new HDD, the computer would still crash after Windows 10 1703 build. Tried with another Windows 10 key, worked like a charm! Tried again with the key provided with laptop, same BSOD. The 1703 update was rejecting the key provided with the machine. Also, I realized the Windows key sticker was already scratched and the key was fully revealed when i received it!

N82E16834234993.Title: LightWeight, Portable, Fast
N82E16834234993.Author: Joshua M.
N82E16834234993.Cons: I don't have too many complaints about this laptop, however I will list a few things. To start with I don't like having to use dongles since they are sometimes an easy thing to lose. The next would have to be that McAfee came pre-installed on the machine, granted this is a personal preference, I removed it as it has caused me trouble in the past. After that the only other issue I had with software was that after Windows updated, the fingerprint scanner is not always responsive so I found myself typing the password in if I locked the machine, or if it went to sleep, on a fresh reboot it works every time. Noise wise I did notice a very tiny amount of hissing or what people call coil whine if I was close to the laptop when it was under a heavy load (in my case watching a movie laying on my couch). And finally my last nit-pick would be that the top being so glossy and snazzy as it is, it is a total fingerprint magnet and needs wiped down quite a bit. I don't feel it deserves to lose an egg since some of this is personal preference and different usages cases would yield different results.
N82E16834234993.Pros: Out of the box this laptop felt lightweight and well built. While being small and portable is was very fast and capable for most tasks including some light gaming. While being small and portable the screen features full HD resolution (1920x1080) and the picture is decent. Battery life was 1.5 -  8 hours in my usage cases, depending on if I was watching videos, playing a game (yes it has nVidia graphics so it can run some games), browsing the web, or working on documents. The backlit keyboard is also a welcome addition. When under load the laptop was not too noisy and didn't seem to get all too hot ( though it did get rather warm under continuous loads).  Windows 10 was not too much of a hassle to get setup and running, and the laptop itself didn't seem to be too loaded down with unwanted software or extras. The speakers also sound decent for their size. The SSD is decent speed wise (sata speeds) and just adds to how well the unit runs overall. It came with a small assortment of accessories, such as a USB to LAN dongle, an HDMI dongle, and a storage sleeve. The fingerprint scanner is nice when it works (see cons).
N82E16834234993.Comments: I used this laptop now for about 4 weeks, it has been stable and fast. It's very portable and light. And while it's not a gaming machine, it was able to play some games and handled multimedia, like Youtube, very well. It would be nice if the memory was upgradable, and I could ask for some more ports, but these are the sacrifices made to have an ultra-portable computer. I cannot fault it since it runs fast and is very stable for how much power they have packed into such a small and lightweight machine. I could easily recommend this laptop to anyone who needs a portable, yet high powered laptop, having an i7 and an SSD just make working on it nice and quick with very few if any hiccups. Lastly I will say that it can play games, and will get warm and throttle when doing so, however it's not sold as a gaming laptop, so I have no real complaints with it. It has been a joy to use during all of my testing.

N82E16834299861.Title: Wouldn't Boot Up  the OS and Here's Why...
N82E16834299861.Author: Brian W.
N82E16834299861.Cons: This came with Win OS installed, however upon boot, blue screen, and popup saying [STOPCODE: Inaccessible Boot Device]. Come to figure out that - in the Bios, and navigating to System Config > Sata Operations, the IRRT option was check marked, which was not correct, and the AHCI box needed to be marked instead. After changing this in the Bios, everything came alive. This was definitely not cool, and tells me that this laptop wasn't tested before being shipped, and this reflects in my overall rating.
N82E16834299861.Pros: Nice little lappy with very minor blemishes. Can connect to either Cat5 cable or WiFi. Delivery was expedient, and all hardware is operating well.
N82E16834299861.Comments: All in all - once the booting issue was resolved, it was (and is) a nice little 14" laptop, that runs well, and looks decent. Granted that hard drive capacity and Ram are mediocre for today's standards (ie: definitely not a gaming machine), it will suffice quite nicely for the average home user who just wants something with a word processor, watch online videos, and the such on. Windows is not my preferred os however, and I was able to easily load a different os onto this laptop, as it has no UEFI issues to deal with. A great laptop for what it is.

N82E16834100228.Title: Excellent
N82E16834100228.Author: Xachary D.
N82E16834100228.Cons: Cost(though compared to similar PC's it's not much of a difference especially taking resale into consideration)
N82E16834100228.Comments: I bought this machine about a year ago and have been extremely impressed. I am an IT professional and use this machine for things the vast majority of users would never think of. I immediately upgraded to 8GB of ram upon receiving it and so far have had no complaints. I can comfortably run a Windows 7 virtual machine and swipe back and forth between that and the Mac OS 10.9 host with no noticeable lag. If I boot into my Windows 8.1 partition I can play games with lowish settings and decent frame rates this includes rift, swtor, and world of tanks(at a little above minimum). If I play WoW, which is extremely rare these days, I can run it at medium settings with 40-50 fps. Not bad for intel integrated graphics. Honestly, it does more than I ever though was possible with an entry level(for Apple) 13" laptop. I am typically a Windows user, and though OS X leaves something to be desired in the ways of window management, it still isn't bad. As for an average day to day user for checking email, watching youtube videos, and the occasional flash game, this will never be an issue. But, for a power user, the lack of reasonable window management can be frustrating. It is excellent for swiping back and forth between two full screen windows, but any more than that becomes cumbersome. Any time I do any web development, or extensive work with spreadsheets and databases and I feel burdened by the software. I also have a seperate Windows 8.1 partition which I use periodically for games. With the Apple bootcamp software, the trackpad and keyboard work wonderfully, take a slight hit in battery life, but otherwise, it works seamlessly. I would recommend this laptop to anyone that wants excellent battery life and quality.

N82E16834100228.Title: Possibly the last great, cheap MacBook Pro
N82E16834100228.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834100228.Cons: Can't think of any serious ones. If were to nitpick I'd say that the magsafe adapter pops out a little too easily sometimes.
N82E16834100228.Pros: I own this, but didn't get it from Newegg (sorry guys, was able to get a much better deal with a NYC outfit this time around).

N82E16834100228.Title: Nice when it works
N82E16834100228.Author: Kevin C.
N82E16834100228.Cons: ...things started breaking. Now I baby my electronics, I don't throw them in a bag or toss them on the table or whatever that causes wear on other people's laptops. I had no dents, no scratches on this laptop, I even had a screen protector on it and a keyboard cover. One complaint, the laptop always ran a bit warm. In fact, on occasion it would get very hot and I could hear the fan spool up and make noise. Come to find out, it's because I watch YouTube videos a lot as well as go to other flash websites and OSX is very inefficient at playing back flash - uses a lot more resources than it should. After about 3 months, it started getting so hot the laptop would shut off.
N82E16834100228.Pros: Looks good, feels well built. Screen looks nice (though I prefer matte finish). Hardware is pretty good, runs most things without a problem. Nice keyboard, nice trackpad. I honestly liked using this laptop, until...
N82E16834100228.Comments: I'm really disappointed in the longevity of this MacBook Pro considering how much it cost. I expect a lot better out of a $1,200 laptop. Before this I used a few cheap PC laptops, and while they were never super fast they did always seem to work. I got tired of having to replace those PC laptops all the time along with the shoddy build quality so I thought a MacBook Pro would be the solution. My warranty runs out this summer and I'm honestly just too afraid of something else going wrong on this. I'll get called the PC fanboy or whatever, but I just want something reliable that works. I'm going to switch over to a ThinkPad when I can sell this - I have a co-worker who has been on a T410 for the past few years without a hitch, and a company I recently did some contract work for also had a fleet of ThinkPads all going strong. Thing is, I can get a well equipped ThinkPad for about $750 which is going to be as fast as my MacBook Pro was - sure it will be running Windows, but as an IT professional I found myself running Win 7 VM all the time since Visual Studio and SQL Server still have no Mac versions and are required for the work I do.

N82E16834100228.Cons: Pricey for a lower end machine, they could have included 8gig rams instead of 4... Maybe make a 13 with discrete graphics and Quad core? As I said above I LOVE this form factor and design but the performance improvements in the 15 are huge!
N82E16834100228.Pros: Coming from a 17 inch Windows based laptop the smaller form factor is awesome for travelling, which I do a lot of. N82E16834100228.Title: Excellent notebook computer
N82E16834100228.Author: Rev. H.
N82E16834100228.Cons: It's a bit pricey.  Some will say you can get a similar laptop for a lot less money.  I don't think so (see below), but, if all you need is the same CPU, RAM and Graphics card, and don't need all of the features that make this unique, then you can spend a lot less money on a windows laptop.
N82E16834100228.Pros: Overall, an excellent machine.  It's lightweight, the fan is absolutely silent in all but the most taxing of applications.  The battery life is stellar at 7+ hours.  It rarely gets warm to the touch at all (during 'typical' use, such as web browsing or desktop publishing, it stays cool to the touch).
N82E16834100228.Comments: Some have commented that it's a 'waste of money' or that you can get 'the same thing' cheaper.  Well that's not true.  If you want cool, quiet, 7+ hours of battery life, a sturdy enclosure, state of the art I/O, all in a lightweight and portable form factor, you can't.  Dell and HP both offer similar laptops, with the same LiPo batteries (though still not quite as long of a battery life), many similar features, and the same basic specs, but they are as expensive or more expensive than the MacBook Pro.

N82E16834100267.Title: Poorly refurb'ed Unibody Macbook.
N82E16834100267.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834100267.Cons: The one I received had many, many scratches (some rather deep ones) on both the top of the LCD's plastic lid, and on the palm rest area. Even worst, was the very large pressure mark on the LCD screen. it was visible on every screen, plus it was bad enough that it was visible even when the laptop was turned off! This pressure mark was roughly 7"- 8" wide and about 4" tall in the middle of the screen. It started about 1/3 of the way down the screen from the top of the screen. Looked like someone had closed a spiral notepad in it, and then just left it there. It should never have been shipped even as a Grade "B" refurb (which it pretty obviously wasn't a refurbished laptop). If that wasn't bad enough, the OS that came on it apparently belonged to a Middle School, and in order to receive any updates you needed the school's password! This was completely unsatisfactory, and I immediately RMA'd it back to Newegg the same day that I received it. They are supposed to be replacing it with a different unit, but that will take an additional 7-10 "business" days from the time they receive it back. The sorry part in this it that their warehouse (Newegg) is only a 30 minute drive from my home.
N82E16834100267.Comments: Yes, even with all the problems I've had, I would still recommend this laptop. My past experiences with this same model Macbook (the UniBody Mac) has always been positive. They are great machines except for the normal cracks that occur in the lid plastic near the LCD hinges. I think I just got a bad one with this purchase, and I wait to see if Newegg provides a decent replacement.

N82E16834234837.Title: Awesome, don't listen to other reviews

N82E16834232601.Title: Literally Falling Apart
N82E16834232601.Author: Sara C.
N82E16834232601.Cons: I'm not hard on my laptops. While I do carry them to/from work 5 days a week, I use a padded case, padded backpack, and I'm careful during transportation. This is my second ASUS. The first one lasted me 5 years... I'll be lucky to get a full year out of this one.
N82E16834232601.Pros: When the laptop boots up, it's "fine." There was a lot of bloatware on it, but that was easy to fix. It came with Windows 8 -- aka, the bane of anyone's existence. Thankfully the Windows 10 upgrade fixed a lot of the issues.

N82E16834232601.Title: $250 laptop with a $500 pricetag
N82E16834232601.Author: Kevin K.
N82E16834232601.Cons: Worst part about this is hands down the track pad. I'd suffer in quiet dissatisfaction through the flimsy discount construction (you've probably gotten sturdier fast food containers) and the fact that it seems to have problems extending to other monitors at 1080p, if it wasn't for how absolutely frustrating the track pad is. The cursor likes to shift dramatically under the slightest pressure and the left/right buttons are part of the trackable area. So if you position the cursor over something, when you lower your finger onto the right-click area, it'll register it as movement before it registers it as a click-- so the cursor moves and you right-click somewhere else. Drag and drop: same problem. Scrolling? Same problem. (Two finger swipe-to-scroll works with IE, not in chrome. I guess that's a software issue and not a hardware issue, but due to the fact that I can't work around it by using trackpad "normally", I'm counting against the laptop itself.). The Fn key to disable the trackpad doesn't even work, so even when I plug a mouse in, the slightest motion of the trackpad while typing sends the screen into a frenzy of undesired activity.
N82E16834232601.Comments: Contrary to the experience of another user, I upgraded to Win10 the first day I got it with no heartache other than possibly losing any pre-installed track-pad disabling software. Whatever other bloat there may have been was wiped clean too, though.

N82E16834232601.Title: Could have been much better for the price. Look elsewhere.
N82E16834232601.Author: David B.
N82E16834232601.Cons: Lots of initial bloatware, shoddy build quality, keyboard drops keystrokes, trackpad stops working randomly, CD drive locks up, battery life drops significantly after a few months of use. Black texture seems to pick up scratches and smudges really easily, particularly on the back of the screen.  Disappointing lack of an SSD
N82E16834232601.Pros: Light weight, good speed, 8gb RAM, decently large screen
N82E16834232601.Comments: I bought this laptop in August 2015 as a daily carry and light use PC for classes. When I first started it up I noticed two things, it made a surprising amount of noise for a new laptop, and it was riddled with bloatware. I fixed those issues as best I could and proceeded to carry it too and from classes for about 6 months now. Over that period of time it developed a number of issues. I began to notice screws falling out of the bottom of the PC, the keyboard dropping keystrokes fairly regularly, and the CD drive has locked up to the point where it won't open, and I'm afraid to force it. Another frustrating issue is the trackpad. Even at the beginning it wasn't great, but that was just a lack of responsiveness. Now it will occasionally stop working altogether, necessitating a reboot of the system. I've also noticed a drop in battery life. When I first got the computer I could get about 6 hrs of battery at medium screen brightness. Now it tells me I can get about 4.

N82E16834232601.Title: DO NOT BUY.
N82E16834232601.Author: Chris B.
N82E16834232601.Cons: DO NOT BUY. Keyboard is one of the worst I have ever used. Keys fail to register keypress until pounded, and repeated keys are often dropped despite setting to the Windows minimum delay. Manipulative configuration and extensive junkware from the manufacturer will require a vanilla Windows install.
N82E16834232601.Comments: This could have been a great laptop, but instead, it's a laptop designed for people who do not type. Placing the USB port front of the CD-ROM drive also makes this bad for using an external mouse.

N82E16834232601.Author: Marissa G.

N82E16834232601.Pros: Great for light gaming, heavier school work, and multitasking. Stays very cool even when playing games. Very lightweight and recommended for chronically ill people like myself.
N82E16834232601.Comments: I have a lot of trouble using my fingers and keeping things in my lap, but this laptop doesn't bother either.

N82E16834232601.Title: My Mistake
N82E16834232601.Author: Sandra M.
N82E16834232601.Cons: Free Windows 10 upgrade killed the machine, computer froze,bad support from Asus, would not take Windows 7 after a clean format, have to ship to Asus to have anything changed, awful Asus software which was more like adware then software, does not come with a copy of an operating system for repair or reinstallation.
N82E16834232601.Pros: Keyboard had a nice feel to it.
N82E16834232601.Comments: This might be the single worst piece of hardware I have bought in the last 20 years. Very disappointed with Asus on this one.

N82E16834232601.Title: Great Laptop
N82E16834232601.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834232601.Comments: Overall for the price I cant complain. Asus' warranty alone is worth the low cost. The laptop boots up quickly and installed Win 10 without a problem. Wifi adapter is quick and responsive. Areas for improvement, The keyboard is a bit small for my taste and lacks good key depth while giving off warp when pressing down at the same time. The touchpad is very loud but is responsive to touch. The CPU and ram perform very well and provide quick task loading however some delays have come up with the low RPM hdd. The screen is low on resolution but has good angle viewing and colors. Again for the price I think it would be hard to beat. The computer looks nice and performs as advertised. Double boxed and well packed for shipment.

N82E16834232601.Title: Not a bad laptop
N82E16834232601.Author: Joshua H.
N82E16834232601.Cons: So far the only cons i found where, updating from windows 8 to 10, took 6-7 failed attempts, and after about 10 hours of retrying i finally got it to process. not sure if it was user error or not.
N82E16834232601.Pros: Originally purchased this laptop with the intent of just doing schoolwork on it, so i wasn't expecting much out of it but i figured i may as well test the benchmarks. downloaded a single game (bioshock infinity) off of steam and it ran on ultra at the laptop's max resolution with no lag at all. i didn't really expect that with the integrated graphics but it got 60+ fps.
N82E16834232601.Comments: All in all for what i expected, it's a solid laptop, got it on flash sale for 460, and it's exceeded my expectation for what it's worth on a laptop.

N82E16834316264.Title: Well worth it at this price point
N82E16834316264.Author: Shen Z.

N82E16834316264.Title: Portable Capable Bargain!
N82E16834316264.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834316264.Cons: -Slowwww Windows 10 upgrades on slow stock 64 GB EMMC drive
N82E16834316264.Pros: -The upgrade ready M.2 2280 SATA III SSD port is great!  An after market 128GB SSD was a speedy and very inexpensive addition.
N82E16834316264.Comments: Manjaro (Gnome) linux runs fantastically on this laptop.  Gave the 128GB SSD addition to Manjaro and left Windows 10 behind on the stock 64GB EMMC drive where it belongs.  Dual booting for now in the unlikely event Windows 10 is needed once or twice.  Windows 10 has been needed once already to upgrade the BIOS with the latest firmware from the Acer website - a quick, easy and painless operation.  A supervisory password had to be set in the BIOS to make the option to disable secure boot available (to boot linux iso from USB).  After that, just had to change boot order to USB first to install linux iso from USB, and then to the new SSD first after linux install to boot into the GRUB boot menu (Manjaro or Windows) instead of straight to Windows 10 by default.

N82E16834316264.Pros: Fanless is what i love it most, in addition, low power consumption. For normal internet browsing and multimedia function, its more than enough. Got mine  changed to a ngff m2 ssd as adviced by other reviewers. Another good things is fast shipping time, I ordered on 10th and received on 14th.

N82E16834316264.Title: Does it ship to Hong Kong?
N82E16834316264.Author: Anonymous

N82E16834316264.Title: Great value
N82E16834316264.Author: Daniel D.
N82E16834316264.Cons: use care for the power connector, its super tiny. Wish I could have charged through the USB C port...
N82E16834316264.Pros: Just what to amplify the other positive reviews... Great sharp screen, The screen is bright indoors with the brightness set to 50%. Killer battery life 7-9 hours, running Linux Mint 19 on the internal 64GB MMC, Mint works great with no hardware problems, and Windows 10 on a Intel 545s M.2 2280 512GB in the M.2 slot.  Made a backup of the installed acer version of Windows 10, reinstalled the Acer version of windows 10 twice trying to get it onto the M.2 drive and it over wrote the 64GB Linux install. Downloaded the Microsoft Windows 10 media creation tool and did a clean install of Windows 10 on the M.2 512GB Intel SSD with not problems, runs better than with Acer version of windows 10.  *** The acer version of Windows 10 would not allow TRIM to run on the Intel M.2 SSD, that is the reason I used the Windows 10 Media Creation Tool for a unmolested version of Windows 10.  I purchased this for a light weight notebook with a 1080P IPS display to browse the web and document creation.  I thought the 4GB would be to much of a limitation, although its been fine with 10-15 tabs open, even does well with 4K streams on Youtube. I tested the 4K to see if the CPU could handle it, no frame skips. I love this little laptop. Mine was a refurb... and it looked perfect out of the box.

(Can always upgrade the storage with that empty M.2 slot if you really need to)

N82E16834235117.Title: Just what I was looking for
N82E16834235117.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834235117.Comments: This is a really nice unit and I found exactly what I was looking for. The laptop I was replacing was a 2013 model MacBook air that I had installed windows on, on day one. (I have no cause or desire to learn Mac OS.) I liked the thin and light and small footprint. There really wasn't anything windows based to compete at that time.  I used the mac air mostly for surfing in bed, watching movies, organizing media, and to take while traveling. I have desktop PC's decked out for gaming so that is not a priority. Recently, the mac air died and I needed replacement. After some research and comparisons, I settled on this one. This thing is perfect. nearly as thin and nearly as light. Much better screen and resolution. Much faster CPU. Plenty of memory and a 1Tb PCI-E SSD. That's 1Tb! Not much in this price range with that kind of drive. Same battery life which is saying alot. Much better gaming ability. I knew going in this thing wasn't going to run Doom 2016 or Far Cry 5. There are 10 Lb laptops that whine like jet engines to do that. However, the older generation games run surprisingly well. Ie portal, Left 4 Dead, Star Craft. etc. And I mean 60 to 120 fps well. Like perfect. That is a neat and unexpected bonus (those games are fun and a real treat for a boring hotel evening while traveling.) So I give this 5 stars all day long. With such a low power CPU and no HDD at all, it is eerily silent. No heat when on ur lap. Little fan only spins up on big loads like gaming. The screen is perfect. I did not want any resolution higher than 1080p. Just doesn't make sense to me with a 15" screen. More desirable on a 75 inch TV I think. In conclusion, very highly recommended.

Steam installed but the game's were completely unplayable.  Chromebook gives no way to properly update your video card, or check to see if your drivers are up to date. Also no CD/DVD rom
N82E16834314021.Pros: Cheap, great hardware.  The perfect laptop to use for school.  Lightning fast, easy apps to use.  You will not get better hardware for the price. I opted to spend the extra 20 dollars to get this particular model (4GB ram), but it probably didn't make much difference
N82E16834314021.Comments: All in all, this is hands down the best laptop on the market for somebody looking for a basic laptop with no gaming. Unless google has an app for it though, don't plan on doing anything outside of basic web-surfing with this laptop.  With linux experience, some of the obstacles can be overcome, but not easy for the average-joe.

Personally, I am a very techy teen (do not judge my review by my age), and it even met my requirements.  The more I used it, the more I realized how much I do on the internet.  Its battery life is amazing, but not an ideal gaming computer.  There is 320 gb of local storage, which is more than enough with the additional 100gb of free storage in google drive.  After one day I have found "cloud" replacements for all the things I typically do on the computer.  I would sincerely recommend this to anyone who is looking for a secondary computer/ laptop.  The reason I say this is because of its different local storage system.  Google WILL store all of your music (up to 20,000 songs) and store unlimited amount of normal sized pictures in the cloud.  Call me kooky, but I still like having a computer with the pictures and music physically on it.  My mother uses this chromebook as a visual teaching aid (she is an art teacher), the possibilities with this thing is endless.  In conclusion, no matter your age this is a perfect notebook for you.

I was worried that the battery would come depleted and dead alas, it's fully chargeable and holds that charge like new. 4.5 hours with low power settings. It's hit or miss with these refurbs. N82E16834235072.Title: ASUS VivoBook
N82E16834235072.Author: Gentry B.
N82E16834235072.Cons: The biggest drawback of the ASUS VivoBook is the 4GB of system RAM that it comes with.  Product info seems to allude the 16GB on the optane card is in addition to the 4GB.  While the optane card is helpful for mainly bootup times, 4GB of RAM by today's standards may not be enough.  Heavy Internet users who never close browsers could possibly experience applications getting hung up due to low memory availability.  But if 4GB turns out to be not enough, the RAM chip can be upgraded.
N82E16834235072.Pros: The ASUS Vivobook is a great laptop.  There is a lot to like.  The build quality can easily be compared to a certain rival "fruit" company, I won't name, who's comparable product easily cost 2 or 3 times as much.  The VivoBook has an aesthetically beautiful frame.  The shell is seamless and the top has a metallic look, touch and feel.  The build is solid.  It's not too heavy but it does have a noticeable weight and I think it's due to the battery and the additional nVidia MX150 video card built-in.  This particular model has a 15 inch screen which, in my opinion, means it crosses the line into the "less portable" class.  But I guarantee you, it feels portable.  Most people won't be embarrassed to carry it around and it fits very well in a small-ish backpack.  Side note, my 3 year old 15inch gaming laptop does NOT fit in the backpack... the VivoBook's very thin frame made all the difference.  With an enormous battery life, there may not be a need to carry around the power adapter.  Even though the adapter itself is takes up very little space.
N82E16834235072.Comments: Overall the ASUS VivoBook is full of features and can be great to use at home or on the go.  Even with a 15 inch screen, it's portable enough and stylish enough to carry around.  In case anyone is interested, I did try its gaming capabilities.  It is definitely not a gaming laptop, so don't plan on playing any modern AAA games with it.  Most of the modern AAA games require much more DRAM and VRAM.  However, I did try Fortnite and surprisingly it ran fairly smooth at a 1080 resolution but most of the graphics quality settings had to be turned down to medium or lower.  So I imagine less graphics intensive games and modern 2D side scrolling games will run just fine on the nVidia MX150 card.

N82E16834235072.Title: Fantastic value for money with one major caveat
N82E16834235072.Author: Dry P.
N82E16834235072.Cons: The primary flaw of the Asus S510UN is that it ships with a paltry 4GB of system memory. Initial boot and account setup worked perfectly well. I updated the BIOS and Asus drivers. Still no problems. Installing the January cumulative update to Windows 1809, however, brought about frequent blue screens. The cause was the Nvidia MX150 driver starving for memory and crashing. I could fix the blue screens by disabling the Nvidia GPU but that loses a primary selling point of this laptop.
N82E16834235072.Pros: TL/DR; Useless laptop as shipped. Add a $30 4GB memory stick and the Asus S510UN has unbeatable performance for the price.
N82E16834235072.Comments: My 4-star rating is most definitely grading on a curve. Compare the Asus S510UN to high end laptops and it will end up last. That said, the S510UN strikes an excellent compromise between price and a laptop that can be used on the go without weighing down your bag. I deducted a star because of the memory issue. If you order the S510UN, make sure to add a 4GB memory stick to your Newegg cart.

1TS-001A-009V0.Author: James C.
1TS-001A-009V0.Cons: 10-key is non-standard, keboard volume buttons don't work, camera is of the lowest quality, construction is cheap, wi-fi is outdated and appears not upgradable, long boot time
1TS-001A-009V0.Pros: Good screen resolution, good audio, decent performance, almost no bloatware
1TS-001A-009V0.Comments: This is my first Asus computer after a long run of Dell workstations. I was planning to go super high-end on a replacement but the price of this Asus based on its specifications was too good to ignore. I had immediate remorse with the unboxing at how cheap this laptop appeared and felt in my hands.  I can't compare this to my Dell because it would be like comparing a Lexus to a Yugo. Can't wait to get a few dollars in my pocket for a replacement and give this ugly brick to my kids to destroy in 6-months.

N82E16834332119.Title: Laptop is good but the battery life is bad
N82E16834332119.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834332119.Cons: Battery life is as not expected. After 4 to 5 months it has to be plugged to be in working condition
N82E16834332119.Pros: Performance of the laptop is very good as per the specifications.

N82E16834332119.Title: Good laptop

N82E16834332119.Title: Couldn't be happier
N82E16834332119.Author: Sandra M.
N82E16834332119.Cons: -no thinkpad update installed had to find and do this and then install all the correct drivers for the dual optimus solutions, it was in bad need of a BIOS update. So out of box software experience was just meh.
N82E16834332119.Pros: Mine came with an NVIDIA NVS 5400M that worked along with the Intel graphics using Optimus, so that was a surprise (a  good one). It looks like new, not even key wear, have tested it extensively so far, docking bay also has one  more USB 3 port along with the five 2.0's so that that was handy. Great condition, everything worked hardware wise. Decent SSD and eight gigs of RAM makes this dual core i5 look speedier than it really is. Very nice over all. Five eggs for hardware
N82E16834332119.Comments: Looks like on average it's a four egg product. I would buy another if it looked and acted as nicely as this one. No one knew it wasn't brand new.

N82E16834332119.Title: Great product!
N82E16834332119.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834332119.Pros: fast boot. Solid product. I use Thinkpad in the past 15 years.

N82E16834332119.Title: Computer fine; Dock not functioning properly
N82E16834332119.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834332119.Cons: -the dock wont physically attach to the laptop
N82E16834332119.Comments: The laptop and dock I received are in good condition. However, something is wrong with the dock, as the latches will not physically engage with the laptop. They move freely and slide properly, but do not reach far enough into the laptop to catch and hold onto the laptop, which renders the dock useless. I asked if I was able to return the dock by itself for a new one, but they required that the entire product, (laptop, dock, charging cable) be returned in order to get a new product. Obviously that's terribly inconvenient when the laptop and charger are fully functioning, and pretty poor customer service.

N82E16834260713.Title: Used not recertified
N82E16834260713.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834260713.Cons: Big dent in USB port on right side, Hard Drive is failing reported by WD diag software and drive has overheated by melted plastic label on it. NIC stops working. Memory installed was DDR3 1066 not DDR3 1333 as specs indicated.
N82E16834260713.Pros: Laptop looks good from outside, screen has very few scratches.
N82E16834260713.Comments: Returned This Laptop back for refund.

N82E16834260713.Title: Very Satisfied
N82E16834260713.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834260713.Pros: I received the EliteBook very quickly. In setting it up the number 2 key was dead. Must have been overlooked in the refurb testing.  So, I requested an RMA and shipping label from New Egg and received those within an hour.  I sent the EliteBook back on a Monday and received the replacement the following Wednesday. The replacement EliteBook is working perfectly. NewEgg rocks!!
N82E16834260713.Comments: I've been a satisfied NewEgg customer for many years. They stand behind their products either new or refurb. This refurb EliteBook is like new and came with a 12 month warranty.

N82E16834260713.Title: This has been the worst experience ever!  I bought the extended warranty and when you call for replacement parts or anything all you get is the answering machine and never a call back.

N82E16834260713.Pros: Price, Processor, RAM has open slot for easy upgrade from 4GB to 8GB, easy back panel removal for maintenance/upgrades, Windows 7 Professional, two USB 3.0 ports.
N82E16834260713.Comments: There are a few comments here about the battery not being recognized and some owners assume the battery is bad and go through the process of trying to get the battery replaced. When I first turned my computer on, the battery was NOT recognized, and I was concerned that the battery may have been dead. Here is how I fixed it for anyone with a similar issue.

N82E16834294675.Title: Exceptional Dell Laptop for a very reasonable price.

N82E16834294675.Pros: Came in great (refurbished) condition. System performs adequately. Startup was a breeze and the light up keyboard was a nice surprise. Compact and lightweight.
N82E16834294675.Comments: Overall great Laptop. Would definitely recommend this product.

N82E16834294675.Title: Good laptop for the cost
N82E16834294675.Author: Tuan T.

N82E16834294675.Comments: -I'd definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a cheap laptop that can still get the job done

N82E16834294675.Title: As stated

N82E16834231895.Title: Excellent
N82E16834231895.Author: Donald C.
N82E16834231895.Cons: Battery not the best-careful with system updates.
N82E16834231895.Comments: Slow updates when unplugged.  Do not try to apply updates with system unplugged.  Replaced 500GB HD with SSD.  System rocks!  Video is integrated but with faster HD speed video is sufficient.  If I could do it again I would use a little bigger SSD HD (240-256 GB) and add another 4GB of memory.

N82E16834231895.Title: Slow and Frustrating
N82E16834231895.Author: Tony K.
N82E16834231895.Cons: Very slow and frustrating internet speed. My other devices load pages almost instantly, but this computer has to think about it for a while... Drives me crazy! Also, the touchpad could drive someone insane. It is glitchy in that sometimes it doesn't seem to sense the motion of your finger and sometimes it is over-sensitive. Also you need to hammer down on the pad to make it click.
N82E16834231895.Pros: Touch screen works well, Large screen
N82E16834231895.Comments: The fact that I am stuck with Windows 8 is the other Con

N82E16834231895.Title: Asus X550CA
N82E16834231895.Author: Mark H.
N82E16834231895.Cons: Used once during a summer vacation.  Several months later the battery would not reach full power.  Used the laptop for a total of 15-20 hours when it failed to boot.  Took it to get serviced and the Motherboard had died.  $300 for 20 hours of computer usage is low.  No more ASUS for me.
N82E16834231895.Pros: Functionality is good but the battery is only good for about an hour.
N82E16834231895.Comments: Dell and HP have been much more reliable

N82E16834231895.Title: Decent budget laptop ...
N82E16834231895.Author: Anonymous
N82E16834231895.Cons: After having used latest i5 and i7 processors, it is painfully slow. SSD upgrade is almost a necessity.
N82E16834231895.Pros: Intel Pentium ULV 2117U processor is about on par with older Core i3 processor and marginally better performer than newer Celeron processors but it's still budget processor and slow. For the price (on sale under $3XX), it's a pretty good deal.  HD and RAM slot is easy to access. Empty RAM slot means you can max out the RAM at 12G instead of 8G.  Swapping out the slow HD with SSD really boosts the speed noticeably, much more so than boosting RAM.
N82E16834231895.Comments: It comes pre-loaded with Windows 8, not 8.1; therefore, you have to go through gazillion Windows updates before you can update to 8.1.  And it won't automatically update to 8.1.  I had to go to Microsoft website to manually update it.  How daft is Win 8? ... That's right, no off button in the menu, it doesn't have one.  Most significant change from 8 to 8.1?  Yeah, the geniuses at MS finally decide to put an off button in the menu ... brilliant!

N82E16834231895.Author: Raymond Q.
N82E16834231895.Cons: - Not for gaming (was able to play hearthstone and even that didnt run super smooth
N82E16834231895.Pros: - Handles basics internet use and word processing with no issue
N82E16834231895.Comments: Picked this up as a first time laptop for my mom, she is enjoying it. Older laptop that I got on sale, not bad for my mom. She enjoys her new found facebook and netflix account.

N82E16834231895.Title: Great Price!
N82E16834231895.Author: Greg K.
N82E16834231895.Cons: I'm not real fond of the keyboard layout. I don't care for the spaces between each of the keys.
N82E16834231895.Pros: This laptop is fine for what it is and great for the price. My low end HP laptop stop booting and had a CPU error code (determined by flashing lights). Since it was out of warranty I figured it would cost more to fix than buying a replacement. I came across this refurbished laptop and the price was excellent. The touchscreen works well. I also like that it has a 10 key pad. The power cord is a nice change from my previous laptops as well. I like the form factor and not having a heavy brick. It plugs into a powerstrip without blocking the adjacent outlets.
N82E16834231895.Comments: Before buying I read the reviews and am not sure why some users thought it had bluetooth. Maybe the description changed by the time I bought it. I did see the complaint about Windows updates not working. When I first tried to manually install all the important Windows updates, it failed after running a very long time to download, apply, then back out the updates. I was disappointed but found what worked for me was to simply allow Windows to apply updates at shutdown. It did not apply all the updates, but each time I shutdown and allowed updates to be applied, it worked. I beleive all the important updates were applied in 3 reboots. Then I manually applied the optional updates. Lastly I updated from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1. A little time consuming but I just let it churn away while I used my desktop.

N82E16834231895.Title: Corrupts on Windows update
N82E16834231895.Author: Joseph M.
N82E16834231895.Cons: After using it without issue for a day or two my wife started noticing weird response issues.   Webpages would load slow as well as other apps.
N82E16834231895.Pros: Very nice features for the price, touch screen.

N82E16834231895.Title: Problem Solved
N82E16834231895.Author: Jacob P.
N82E16834231895.Cons: Have to spend $3 more dollars. First World Problems! :(
N82E16834231895.Pros: I have used my engineering mind and found a solution to the terrible Bluetooth issue.
N82E16834231895.Comments: Soon I will be joyful again!
